description: Unique identifier for this work order asset procedure code record.
Foreign key to the specific work order asset procedure this entry belongs to.
Timestamp when this entry was first created.
Identifier of the inspection, test, or measurement being recorded for the procedure.
State or status selected for the code (e.g., OK/Fail/NA); likely enumerated; confirm with SME.
Recorded numeric or textual value for the code during the procedure.
Condition or reading observed before maintenance or repair.
Condition or reading after completion of the work.
Maximum acceptable value for the measurement.
Minimum acceptable value for the measurement.
Lower alarm threshold that triggers an alert if crossed.
Upper alarm threshold that triggers an alert if exceeded.
Expected or nominal value used as a reference.
Expected classification when within normal condition; likely enumerated; confirm with SME.
Free-text notes or remarks about the reading or step.
System-maintained timestamp of the most recent update to this record.
Timestamp of the last user-initiated change; meaning may overlap with audit fields; confirm with SME.
Date/time the observation or measurement was captured in the field.
Boolean flag indicating whether recording this code is mandatory to complete the procedure (0=no, 1=yes).
User identifier that created the entry.
Audit timestamp when the creating user saved the entry; confirm difference from Date_created.
User identifier that last modified the entry.
Audit timestamp of the latest user modification.
Foreign key to the asset code definition referenced by this entry.
Comparison operator used to evaluate the value against limits (e.g., >, <, =, between); likely enumerated; confirm with SME.
